body:
This PR not only detects a direct hit, but also computes damage falloff

Like this (visualization from stack overflow)
![](http://i.stack.imgur.com/ri01L.png)
I haven't looked closely, but it seems mostly sensible overall.  Cool!

You replaced RulesetLoaded?
Why?
I wrote it for situations like this.

LoadUsing should be used for

``` Yaml
MCV:
    Health:
        HP: 600
        Shape: Capsule
            Radius: 426
            Vertices: 0, -512, 0, 512
```

because recursive MinYaml loading is not supported (especially custom object creation dispatch).
@atlimit8 Is this better?
Put those two checks in the cases or in the constructors.

@huwpascoe:
See my [comment](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9800#discussion_r43573052) above.

`WDist DistanceFromEdge(WVec p);` might already suit the needs of #9357.
Details in the comment.

The _idea_ behind #9357 code is that you find the shortest distance between the line and the actor, and then check that the distance is less than the weapon's reach + actor's health radius.

As mentioned in the comment, the _weapon's reach + actor's health radius_ check can be swapped to a _weapon's reach + actor's health radius along the shortest distance vector_ check
> OpenRA.Mods.Common/HitShapes/Circle.cs(24,7): error CS0414: Warning as Error: The private field `OpenRA.Mods.Common.HitShapes.HitShapeCircle.radiusSq' is assigned but its value is never used

@reaperrr Don't worry I just noticed it : P (you'd think visual studio would have picked up on that first)

@UberWaffe If you think you can make do with the dist methods then I'll post as is. I got as far as line/circle and line/rectangle (line/capsule still stuck on) so if it turns out you want those methods later I can post them separately.
suffix'd "Shape" to match the rest of the project
Added unit tests and fixed a bunch of stupid mistakes.
Fixed merge conflict
Merged with upstream, still passes.
You need to rebase onto bleed to get rid of the "Merge" commits.
lol mybad. Rebased.

We're really low on review bandwidth right now, and the time that we do have is mainly focused towards the next release.  It may be a while longer before we can continue reviewing this, but please don't take that as a slight against you personally!
No worries!
fixed build error with bleed
Okay replacing the vectors with Actor is a lot cleaner after all

Did a quick test in TS.
The rectangle hitshape does not appear to take the isometric perspective into account.

Though testing it as is: Projectiles are impacting properly with the rectangle hitshape.
Code looks good to me aside from those remaining test nits.  I haven't had a chance to test this ingame.
I've made changes (although I can't test the makefile works)
Needs a rebase.
Unit tests now work.
Rebased

Do we want to tackle actually applying this anywhere in this PR, or is somebody going to follow up with some changes?

Also, needs a rebase.

> Do we want to tackle actually applying this anywhere in this PR, or is somebody going to follow up with some changes?

I wouldn't mind doing a follow-up if nobody else volunteers. Using rectangular hitboxes for buildings, for example, will likely not only result in a large yaml diff, but also have an effect on balance, so I believe it would be better to tackle that in a separate PR (or multiple ones).
